topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: The Seagull Oracle
ideas.premise: Nana uses a seagull at St Kilda pier to interpret her saltwater stories, mistaking its squawks for ancient prophecies.
ideas.why_funny: Seagulls are pests, and Nana's delusional interpretation is inherently humorous.

ideas.title: Fairy Bread Deep Dive
ideas.premise: Nana explains her saltwater stories using fairy bread analogies, confusing her grandson immensely.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of the mundane fairy bread with profound sea tales is unexpected.

ideas.title: The Yarra River Conspiracy
ideas.premise: Nana believes the Yarra River secretly connects to all the world's oceans, hiding the truth of her stories.
ideas.why_funny: The Yarra being anything other than brown is ridiculous.

ideas.title: Melbourne Star Constellations
ideas.premise: Nana points out constellations that depict events from her saltwater stories, but they're just the Melbourne Star.
ideas.why_funny: Misinterpreting a Ferris wheel as cosmic significance is absurd.

ideas.title: Frankston Foreshore Forecast
ideas.premise: Nana uses seaweed from Frankston Foreshore to predict the future of her saltwater story's characters.
ideas.why_funny: Frankston Foreshore seaweed as a mystical tool is inherently silly.

headlines.title: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories
headlines.summary: Actor and author Tasma Walton was enjoying her big break on TV show Blue Heelers in the 1990s in Melbourne when a transformative visit from her grandm
